Title: scponly: Multiple privilege escalation issues
Synopsis:
Local users can exploit an scponly flaw to gain root privileges, and
    scponly restricted users can use another vulnerability to evade shell
    restrictions.

Background.Text: scponly is a restricted shell, allowing only a few predefined commands. It is often used as a complement to OpenSSH to provide access to remote users without providing any remote execution privileges.

Description.Text: Max Vozeler discovered that the scponlyc command allows users to chroot into arbitrary directories. Furthermore, Pekka Pessi reported that scponly insufficiently validates command-line parameters to a scp or rsync command.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could gain root privileges by chrooting into arbitrary directories containing hardlinks to setuid programs. A remote scponly user could also send malicious parameters to a scp or rsync command that would allow to escape the shell restrictions and execute arbitrary programs.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
